DataElement.preferredName: Experimental Entity Allocation Reuse Template Study Activity Repeat Quantity ISO21090.URG.INT.NONNEG.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An administrative activity defined at a global library level that is the assignment of an experimental unit to a portion of the study, such as an arm or a portion of an arm (when secondary allocations may occur). EXAMPLE(S): randomization, direct assignment based on eligibility criteria, etc. For "escalating dose cohort studies," enroll subjects in successive arms, i.e., one arm is completely filled before any subjects are enrolled in the next arm. In such a trial, allocation depends on which arms have been fully enrolled and which are currently open for enrollment. The number of times the activity occurs. NOTE(S): If the frequency is more than once a day, this is still interpreted per time, e.g. BID for 5 days = 10 repeats.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Experimental Entity Allocation Reuse Template Study Activity Repeat Quantity
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Being studied; investigational; derived by experimentation.:An independently existing thing (living or nonliving).:The distribution of resources over various time periods, products, operations, or investments.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._Make or do or perform again.:How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

Concepts.definition: Being studied; investigational; derived by experimentation.
An independently existing thing (living or nonliving).
The distribution of resources over various time periods, products, operations, or investments.
Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Make or do or perform again.:How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
